intro: Marila biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered marila, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typically blooming in the spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild, spicy scent. Marila biflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along streambanks.
